repnme.cdata!: Chad - Petroleum and Power Engineering Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Petroleum and Power
            Engineering Project for Chad was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that it
            is important to tailor assistance to individual country
            needs rather than try to make a general Bank policy fit all
            countries, keeping sight of key objectives such as poverty
            reduction and improved quality of life. Chad's country
            situation had special characteristics that made it an
            exception to general policies for petroleum development in
            Africa. Project conditions should be defined clearly during
            project preparation and should not evolve during
            implementation. Rather than focusing on these special
            conditions and the urgency for the Project, the Bank set new
            and additional conditions on the project, especially by
            insisting that private international oil companies take the
            lead in the project when the interest was not there. In a
            difficult country situation, there can be considerable value
            to keep a small technical assistance project open and
            maintain flexibility in its implementation. Delays in
            development projects due to political and economic
            instability in poor countries that depend on external
            assistance have high costs to the economy and inhibit
            poverty reduction. Technical Assistance projects should not
            include implementation components.

repnme.cdata!: Chad - Petroleum and Power Engineering Credit

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the project is to
            complete the preparation of a proposed petroleum and power
            project.  It will help to prepare project specifications,
            budgetary cost estimates and tender documents with
            sufficient detail to permit calling for three separate
            turnkey contract bids (one each for the pipeline, refinery
            and power plant), thus ensuring the most efficient and least
            cost execution of the proposed petroleum and power project.
            The project will also make technical assistance and
            specialized expertise available to the government and to
            Societe d'Etude et d'Exploitation de la Raffinerie
            du Tchad (SEERAT).
